Class EditorWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.World
      • EditorWorld
  • public abstract class EditorWorld
extends greenfoot.World
    The EditorWorld class is a world that displays a level and instructions for editing the level. You can add tiles of any type that has been defined using the addType method. You can save the level when finished editing. You can edit a new level or load and existing level.
    Version:
    4/14/2023
    Author:
    Ted McLeod

    • Field Detail

      • gridOffsets

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<? extends greenfoot.Actor>,​java.awt.Point> gridOffsets
        how much should instances of each class be offset from the center of a grid position. You can define an offset by writing: 
          EditorWorld.GRID_OFFSETS.put(ClassName.class, new Point(dx, dy));

      • gridWidth

        public static int gridWidth
        The grid width of each grid rectangle. All objects drawn in the editor will be snapped to the center of a grid position where the grid is made up of imaginary rectangles of the given dimensions. Except, they will be offset as described if there is an offset defined in GRID_OFFSETS.

      • gridHeight

        public static int gridHeight
        The grid height of each grid rectangle. All objects drawn in the editor will be snapped to the center of a grid position where the grid is made up of imaginary rectangles of the given dimensions. Except, they will be offset as described if there is an offset defined in GRID_OFFSETS.

        The margin at the bottom of the HUD

        The first instructions that show up at the top of the hud

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        Called on the world every frame. Responds to user input.
        Overrides:
        act in class greenfoot.World

      • defineTypes

        public abstract void defineTypes()
        Defines the types of tiles that can be added to a level. Add the types using the addType method as in this example: 
         // add a Wall class that is written as a W in the save file and
 // can be set as the active tile by pressing W
 addType("W", "W", Wall.class);

      • drawBackground

        Draw the background of the editor world

      • addType

        public void addType​(java.lang.String symbol,
                    java.lang.String key,
                    java.lang.Class<? extends greenfoot.Actor> cls)
        Adds the given class as a type of tile that can be added to the level. The symbol is the string that will be written to the file when saving tiles of this type and the key is the key that should be pressed to make that the active tile.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol to write to the file that represents that type of tile
        key - the key that should be pressed to make this tile the active tile
        cls - the class to add (example: Ball.class)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the symbol contains white space

      • setDrawClass

        public void setDrawClass​(java.lang.Class<? extends greenfoot.Actor> cls)
        Set the class that should be drawn when clicking or dragging.
        Parameters:
        cls - The class that should be drawn when clicking or dragging.

      • getGridPos

        public java.awt.Point getGridPos​(int x,
                                 int y)
        The coordinates of the center of the grid square that contains (x, y)
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the center of the grid square that contains (x, y)

      • snapToGrid

        public void snapToGrid()
        Snap all the actors in the world to the center of grid coordinates. This should really only be used for debugging purposes since it will snap all actors to grid including Text objects.

      • getInstanceOfDrawClass

        public greenfoot.Actor getInstanceOfDrawClass()

        Returns:
        an instance of the current active class
